answers.answer: I have the same situation.  When did they start?  In my case, I think they are TIAs and small strokes that don't show up on scans.  Does she have brain injury or has she had a stroke before?

My son (11) had a large seizure a while back and his face dropped slightly on one side for a while..it was very worrying! I told his neuro nurse about it and she said after a big seizure it can happen. She gave it the name Todds pariesis (spelling is probably wrong) you just reminded me I wanted to research what it was..hope this helped!

Hi, I had two strokes in 1969. I was 5 years old. I have seizures from time to time.My story isn't important, but you should take your mother get checked out in in a hospital by a neurologist, and then you would know more. I still get checked out every six months, I have blood tests when I am being told that I should have one.....or other tests...and that, after 45 years...until the rest of my life.I wish you good luck in finding what your mother has fast.David

Do you know any thing else? I'm a 67 year old cardiac patient with diabetes. I've been having all kinds of weird symptoms and am on all kinds of meds. Among those symptoms are the goosebumps and tingling on my left arm and elsewhere. When I mention this, it's being ignored because I've so much going on. Two years ago I was vey active and now I'm stuck being a couch potato because I feel so lousy. I won't accept being old!

question: PLEASE HELP! My mother was diagnosed with seizures a couple of years ago. Odd to me that before being diagnosed I never witnessed these seizures. After being diagnosed and put on seizure meds she has full tonic clonic seizures at times. At times she has facial droopings with the seizures making it look like TIA's. All tests (EEG, CT, MRI's) have been negative. While she was on Depakote the seizures were still not controlled. Almost feel as if these are not seizures and something serious is wrong but the docs are unable to diagnose her.  She has seen many neurologists and MD's for her condition. Any suggestions or advice? Please offer some good insight. I am a nurse so I am familiar with all that is going on.      Thanks!!!
title: Is facial drooping with seizures possible?
